titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 415) to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate segments of the Taunton River in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-758, by Mr. McGovern.

The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill except clauses 9 and 10 of rule XXI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Natural Resources now printed in the bill shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 247.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1339.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1339, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hastings (WA) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.

UNFINISHED BUSINESS - The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question of adoption of ordering the previous question and on adoption of both H.Res. 1343 and H.Res. 1339, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 198 (Roll no. 497).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 224 - 195 (Roll no. 498).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/14/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 415) to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate segments of the Taunton River in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.
